page.title: 02THE RED ARROWS
page.content: On Wednesday 17th April, most of Holywell School interrupted their lessons to watch the famous{Red Arrows air display team perform in the skies over Cranfield. As we watched from various points around the school, the{ Red Arrows performed many stunts including fake collision courses, the square and diamond and the "Concorde" formations. They coloured the event with red and blue vapour trails left behind as they performed many complex and carefully rehearsed formations. This display was part of the Rank Xerox show "Innovation 85", attended by{ Prince Michael of Kent, }who was there to present medals to the pilots and groundstaff of the{Red Arrows.
